metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0225 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When processing user provided XML documents, the Spring Framework 4.0.0 to 4.0.4, 3.0.0 to 3.2.8, and possibly earlier unsupported versions did not disable by default the resolution of URI references in a DTD declaration. This enabled an XXE attack. It was discovered that the Spring Framework incorrectly handled XML documents. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, disclosure of information or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-beans-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-context-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-context-support-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-core-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-expression-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-instrument-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-jms-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-messaging-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-orm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-oxm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-test-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-transaction-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-web-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.6.RELEASE-14').
